teaser: A Federal Reserve banker in Texas has warned the so-called 'feral hogs' of the financial markets to stop overreacting to the Federal Reserve's plans to wind down quantitative easing. What does it all mean?
title: Top central banker calls investors 'feral hogs'
contentencoded:
A Federal Reserve banker in Texas has warned the so-called "feral hogs" of the financial markets to stop overreacting to the Federal Reserve's plans to wind down quantitative easing. What does it all mean?

Juli Niemann, analyst at Smith, Moore & Company, joins Marketplace Morning Report host David Brancaccio to discuss.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Tuesday, June 25, 2013
